title: (x) Condensed sans used for Windows Mobile 6.1 UI - Segoe {Frode Helland}
content:
Could anybody identify the condensed typeface used for the UI of Windows Mobile 6.1?

[http://crave.cnet.com/i/bto/20080328/2008-03-28\_162358\_270x203.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130920162457/http:/crave.cnet.com/i/bto/20080328/2008-03-28_162358_270x203.jpg "http://crave.cnet.com/i/bto/20080328/2008-03-28\_162358\_270x203.jpg")

Your help is appreciated. Thank you.  
HM
author: distributedhuman

comments.content:
Looks like there are "Segoe UI" and "Segoe" and they are different.  
 [http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa511282.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20130920162457/http:/msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa511282.aspx "http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa511282.aspx")

Perhaps it's "Segoe UI" but I couldn't find any condensed.

Attached here is a better image.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130920162457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/windows_mobile_61_5319.png)

For you to check...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130920162457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ui_6274.PNG)

(Segoe Condensed Bold)

I neglected to mention that you can get a copy of Segoe Condensed (including Bold) for free by downloading and installing the [Windows Mobile 6 SDK](http://web.archive.org/web/20130920162457/http:/www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=06111A3A-A651-4745-88EF-3D48091A390B).

Of course, you'll have to adhere to whatever is in the EULA that comes with the installation package.
woohoo. my first x :) although I have ID'd some earlier.
Yeah, I know -- I'm waaay behind on my (x)-ing and tagging. I've given up all hope on (a) ever catching up and (b) the Type ID Board ever being upgraded to a more efficient version.
